Linear Operator

F(aΦ1+bΦ2)=a⋅FΦ1+b⋅FΦ2∀Φ1,Φ2F(a\bm\Phi_1 + b\bm\Phi_2) = a\cdot F\bm\Phi_1 + b\cdot F\bm\Phi_2\quad \forall \bm\Phi_1, \bm\Phi_2F(aΦ1​+bΦ2​)=a⋅FΦ1​+b⋅FΦ2​∀Φ1​,Φ2​

Eigenvalue, Eigenfunction

Fun=fnunFu_n = f_nu_nFun​=fn​un​
unu_nun​

is a eigen function to the operator

FFF

with corresponding eigenvalue

fnf_nfn​

.

Hermitian Operator

∫(Hu)∗v d3r=∫u∗Hv d3r,∀u,v\int (Hu)*v\: d^3r = \int u*Hv \: d^3r, \quad \forall u, v∫(Hu)∗vd3r=∫u∗Hvd3r,∀u,v

A hermitian operator has real eigenvalues and corresponding eigenfunctions can be choosen to be orthonormal. Practically all operators in quantum mechanics are linear and hermitian.

Eigenfunction Expansion

ψ(r)=∑nanm⋅un(r),an=∫un∗⋅ψ⋅d3r\bm\psi(\bm r) = \sum_na_nm\cdot u_n(\bm r),\quad a_n = \int u_n*\cdot\bm\psi\cdot d^3rψ(r)=n∑​an​m⋅un​(r),an​=∫un​∗⋅ψ⋅d3r

Expansion Postulate

At a meassurement of an observable

FFF

on a system described by a wavefunction

ψ\bm\psiψ

only eigenvalues of the operator

FFF

can be found. The probability of the result

F=fnF = f_nF=fn​

is given by

P(F=fn)=∣∫un∗ψ d3r∣2,Fun=fnunP(F = f_n) = \left|\int u_n*\bm\psi\: d^3r\right|^2, \quad Fu_n = f_nu_nP(F=fn​)=∣∣​∫un​∗ψd3r∣∣​2,Fun​=fn​un​

Momentum Operators

L2=−ℏ2[1sin⁡2θ∂2∂φ2+1sin⁡θ∂∂θ(sin⁡θ∂∂θ)]L^2 = -\hbar^2\left[\frac 1{\sin^2\theta}\frac{\partial^2}{\partial\varphi^2} + \frac 1{\sin\theta}\frac\partial{\partial\theta}\left(\sin\theta\frac\partial{\partial\theta}\right)\right]L2=−ℏ2[sin2θ1​∂φ2∂2​+sinθ1​∂θ∂​(sinθ∂θ∂​)]

and

LzL_zLz​

LzΥlm=mℏΥlmL_z \Upsilon_l^m = m\hbar\Upsilon_l^mLz​Υlm​=mℏΥlm​
lmΥlm(θ,φ)00Υ00=14π10Υ10=34πcos⁡θ1±1Υ1±1=±38πsin⁡θe±iφ20Υ20=516π(3cos⁡2θ−1)2±1Υ2±1=±158πsin⁡θcos⁡θe±iφ2±2Υ2±2=1532πsin⁡2θe±2iφ\def\arraystretch{2.5} \begin{array}{ccc} \hline l & m & \Upsilon_l^m(\theta, \varphi) \\ \hline 0 & 0 & \Upsilon_0^0 = \frac 1{\sqrt{4\pi}} \\ 1 & 0 & \Upsilon_1^0 = \sqrt{\frac 3{4\pi}}\cos\theta\\ 1 & \pm1 & \Upsilon_1^{\pm1} = \pm\sqrt{\frac 3{8\pi}}\sin\theta e^{\pm i\varphi}\\ 2 & 0 & \Upsilon_2^0 = \sqrt{\frac 5{16\pi}}\left(3\cos^2\theta - 1\right)\\ 2 & \pm1 & \Upsilon_2^{\pm1} = \pm\sqrt{\frac {15}{8\pi}}\sin\theta\cos\theta e^{\pm i\varphi}\\ 2 & \pm2 & \Upsilon_2^{\pm2} = \sqrt{\frac {15}{32\pi}}\sin^2\theta e^{\pm 2i\varphi}\\ \hline \end{array}l011222​m00±10±1±2​Υlm​(θ,φ)Υ00​=4π​1​Υ10​=4π3​​cosθΥ1±1​=±8π3​​sinθe±iφΥ20​=16π5​​(3cos2θ−1)Υ2±1​=±8π15​​sinθcosθe±iφΥ2±2​=32π15​​sin2θe±2iφ​​

Commutators and Momentum Operators

ϵijk={1ijk  even−1ijk  odd0otherwise\epsilon_{ijk} = \begin{cases} 1 & ijk \;\textup{even} \\ -1 & ijk\; \textup{odd} \\ 0 & \textup{otherwise} \end{cases}ϵijk​=⎩⎨⎧​1−10​ijkevenijkoddotherwise​
[xi,pj]=iℏ⋅δij[x_i, p_j] = i\hbar\cdot\delta_{ij}[xi​,pj​]=iℏ⋅δij​
[xi,Lj]=iℏ⋅ϵijk⋅xk[x_i, L_j] = i\hbar\cdot\epsilon_{ijk}\cdot x_k[xi​,Lj​]=iℏ⋅ϵijk​⋅xk​
[Li,Lj]=iℏ⋅ϵijk⋅Lk[L_i, L_j] = i\hbar\cdot\epsilon_{ijk}\cdot L_k[Li​,Lj​]=iℏ⋅ϵijk​⋅Lk​
[xi,xj]=[pi,pj]=0[x_i, x_j] = [p_i, p_j] = 0[xi​,xj​]=[pi​,pj​]=0
[pi,Lj]=iℏ⋅ϵijk⋅pk[p_i, L_j] = i\hbar\cdot\epsilon_{ijk}\cdot p_k[pi​,Lj​]=iℏ⋅ϵijk​⋅pk​
